result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo R Kane was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants 2 days credit if revoked.

11-02-2022: CORRECTED TO INCLUDE PROBATION TERM ORDERED OF 12 MONTHS

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Complete Thinking for a Change Course.  Attend Anger Management course to be determined by Agent.

No new law violations.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation within the first 6 months of probation.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

records.addlTxt: Atty David Stegall requests to have 6/28 removed and to be set with his underlying case (21CM1291) Sent to Bailey to review. Court's response: Because the defendant now has counsel and there is no victim, the matter may be placed on judge's calendar while vacating the June 28th court date. Counsel is responsible for notifying his client.
Filed by Atty. David Michael Stegall

Adjustment Number: 22A 025041,

Receipt Number: 22R 026956,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to have no contact with Jimmy John's listed in the Criminal Complaint.

02:13 PM Defendant Ricardo R Kane in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Attorney Wang is asking to set this matter back before the Commissioner for status of counsel.  The Court will set this matter back before the Commissioner for status of counsel to allow the defendant time to determine whether he intends on retaining counsel.  Hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
